Express response object. Used in conjunction with middleware to scope environment variables for customized versions of the original Koji app. For the original definition see [[https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/master/types/express/index.d.ts#L127 | @types/express]].
Generates an extensible configuration for the Koji app's backend services.

comment.text: Configuration information for the Koji app.

comment.shortText: Possible response values when interacting with the database API.
The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error
comment.text:
One of the following error conditions:
Unable to parse data.
Missing data.
The request attempts data that is too large.
The data contains invalid child names as part of the path.
The data path is too long.
The request contains an unrecognized server value.
The request does not support one of the query parameters that is specified.
The request mixes query parameters with a shallow request.

comment.shortText: A server error occurred.
The specified Database was not found.
Standard response for successful HTTP requests.
The request's specified ETag value in the if-match header did not match the server's value.
The specified Database is temporarily unavailable, which means the request was not attempted.

Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet
been provided.
comment.text:
One of the following error conditions:
The user token has expired or is missing.
The user token used in the request is invalid.

A Koji database is included with each Koji project and stores key-value pairs.

comment.shortText: API routes for iap methods.
Manages in-app purchases on the backend of your Koji app.
Instantiates the IAP class.
Captures a pending transaction.
comment.text:
NOTE: If your IAP product is defined with the `captureOnPurchase` key set to `false`, the transaction is held in a pending state until you manually invoke `captureTransaction`.
Funds are not available in the seller's account until the transaction is captured.
If you do not capture the transaction before the `captureExpiryPeriod`, the transaction is automatically reversed and the buyer is refunded.
This period can be specified in the product definition from 0 to 7 days (default is 0).
Unique identifier for the transaction receipt.

comment.shortText:
Gets the properties of a specified product, which enables the app to leverage dynamic product information.
For example, you can check the stock for a product with limited quantity (via the `numAvailable` property), and indicate the number of remaining items.
comment.returns: Properties of the specified product.

comment.text: Identifier for the product.

comment.shortText: Refunds a transaction.
comment.text: NOTE: Only unsettled transactions can be refunded.
Unique identifier for the transaction receipt.

comment.shortText:
Gets a specific transaction receipt by its ID, which can be used to facilitate fulfillment.
For example, use a dynamic receipt to upload a video response from the seller and then share that response with the buyer.
Or, capture product options, such as color or size, to display to the seller in an admin view.
comment.returns: Object for the specified receipt.

comment.text: Unique identifier for the receipt.

comment.shortText: Gets all receipts for the current user, which can be used to validate purchases for specific products.
comment.returns: Array of receipts for the user's purchases.

comment.text: Short-lived IAP token for the current user.

comment.shortText: Gets all receipts for a specified product, which can be used to aggregate sales data.
comment.returns: Array of receipts for the specified product.

comment.text: Identifier for the product. Products are defined in the entitlements file and registered or updated when the project is deployed.

comment.shortText:
Updates the custom attributes for a specified receipt.
For example, if a user purchases a credit toward a product on the Koji app and then uses it, you can update the receipt to indicate that the credit has been consumed and is not available for future sessions.
comment.returns: Confirmation of the update, if the request was successful, or an error message, if not.

comment.text: Unique identifier for the receipt.
Object of key-value paired attributes to store with the receipt.
Custom message to sent the user when the receipt is updated (up to 80 characters). If undefined, the message will read: `Your receipt for PRODUCT_NAME was updated.`

If you do not capture the transaction before the `captureExpiryPeriod`, the transaction is automatically reversed and the buyer is refunded.
This period can be specified in the product definition from 0 to 7 days (default is 0).

comment.shortText:
Specific product for purchase.
Products are defined in the entitlements file of the app and are registered or updated when the project is deployed.
Use [[loadProduct]] to retrieve the properties associated with a products SKU.
Name of the Koji app from which the product was purchased.
Period within which a pending transaction must be captured before it is reversed, from 0 to 7 days. Default is 0.
Whether to capture transactions immediately. If set to false, transactions are held in a pending state until they are manually captured with [[captureTransaction]].
Date the product was registered or updated, which happens when the app is deployed.

Whether the transaction receipt can display the `receipt` context of the app. If enabled, use {@doclink core-frontend-playerstate#context | Koji.playerState.context} to detect the `receipt` context, and use {@doclink core-frontend-playerstate#receiptType | Koji.playerState.receiptType} to determine whether the buyer or the seller is viewing the receipt.
Type of user information collected for order fulfillment. Defined in the entitlements file.
Unique identifier for this version of the product.
Indicator of whether the product is still available for purchase.
Indicator of whether a product can be purchased more than once. Defined in the entitlements file.
Description displayed when the user was prompted to purchase the product. Defined in the entitlements file.
Remaining number of times the product can be sold. Calculated based on the total inventory defined in the entitlements file, less the number of purchases.
Object that represents the seller.
Koji username of the seller.
Purchase price of the product. Defined in the entitlements file.
Indicator of whether a purchase price is defined for the product. Defined in the entitlements file.
Array of [[IapReceipt]] objects representing purchases of the product.
Total number of times the product can be sold (inventory threshold). Defined in the entitlements file.
Identifier of the purchased product. Defined in the entitlements file.

Receipt for a users purchase of a product.
Resolve receipts with [[resolveReceiptById]], [[resolveReceiptsByIAPToken]], or [[resolveReceiptsBySku]].
Add custom attributes for to a receipt with [[updateReceipt]].

Object containing a list of custom key-value pairs associated with the receipt.
You can use [[updateReceipt]] to update these values.
Additionally, the fulfillment information (email, phone, or address) and customMessage are included this object, if set at purchase time.
Date of the purchase.
Date of the refund, if the transaction has been refunded. Refunds can occur either manually or due to capture expiry of a pending transaction.
Unique identifier for the product.
Price the user paid for the product.
Unique identifier for the receipt.

Object containing references to the associated transaction receipts  `credit` for the user receiving the funds (seller), `debit` for the user sending the funds (buyer).
To link to the transaction receipt in the users Koji wallet, use the format `https://withkoji.com/payments/transactions/TXN_ID`.
Information about a Koji user.
The user's display name (if access was granted).
The user's profile URL.
Unique identifier for the user.
Whether the user is verified.
The user's profile picture (if access was granted).
The user's username (if access was granted).

comment.shortText:
Defines a notification to send to a user.
Use [[pushNotificationToOwner]] to send notifications to the owner of the Koji app.
Use [[pushNotificationToUser]] to send notifications to any user who interacts with the Koji app and has granted the appropriate authorization.
Headline for the message. For example, the name of the Koji app that generated the notification.
Icon to display next to the message, either the URL of an image or an emoji character.
Content of the message.
Query parameters to append to the Koji app's URL when the notification is tapped. For example, load the admin experience or a dynamic receipt from the notification.
Information about a user of the Koji app. To retrieve a user's information, use [[resolveUserFromToken]].
Object containing custom information about the user.
Date the user's information was created or updated on this Koji.
Object containing information about capabilities that the user has authorized this Koji to use.
Users unique ID for this Koji.
Users role for this Koji  the owner/creator (`admin`), not the owner (`user`), or not logged in (`unknown`).
Object containing information about capabilities that the user has authorized this Koji to use.
Whether the user has granted push notification access.

Amount of time for which the signed URL remains valid, in seconds. If undefined, signed videos expire after 1 hour, and any other resource expires after 5 minutes.

comment.returns: Decrypted value.

comment.shortText: Provides utility methods for improving the performance and functionality of your Koji app.
Instantiates the Utilities class.
Regenerates thumbnails for the Koji app.
Unfreezes a response that has been frozen with an `x-koji-freeze-key` header.
comment.text:
Freeze Keys enable you to cache and purge content in Kojis CDN,
dramatically improving the speed and reliability of backend data requests
in your Koji apps.

Make a request directly to the Koji CDN and receive a cached response,
instead of waiting for the backend to warm up and serve the request.

Use the `x-koji-freeze-key` header to instruct the CDN to serve a cached
response and `KojiBackend.Utilities.unfreeze` to reset the cache. The
platform automatically handles remix scoping, so you can maintain one set
of logic in your templates.

Note that Freeze Keys are useful when responses should be cached
indefinitely, until some manual action triggers a purge (e.g., a
leaderboard for a game should be cached until a new score is added, at
which point it is unfrozen and regenerated). If you wish to implement
simple time-based caching at the CDN level (i.e., clients do not cache
responses, but they are cached in the CDN until expiry), use the
`x-koji-cache-control` header on the response, which functions the same way
as the standard `Cache-Control` HTTP header.
Key used to freeze the response.

comment.shortText:
Enables you to track custom events in your Koji apps.
For example, track `onClick` events for the links and buttons in a Koji app.
comment.text:
To view the analytics data for a published Koji app, view the published app, click the **App** link, and then **Open Analytics**.
You will see data for the custom events along with a standard set of built-in metrics, which are calculated from the apps access logs.

TIP: Analytics data is processed at frequent intervals throughout the day. If you are testing the custom events in a published app and you dont see results at first, wait 10 minutes to account for data processing latency, and then check again.

comment.shortText: Generates an analytics event with the specified name and data payload, if applicable.
comment.returns: Indicates whether the event was generated.

Total clients to allow on a shard before it is full (defaults to 100). When a shard is full, new clients are added to a new shard unless a different shard is explicitly set.
Name of the dispatch shard to use. If not specified, the client is added to a shard automatically.
Defines a DispatchOptions interface.
Defines a DispatchOptions interface.
Defines a MessageHandler interface.
Information about a dispatch shard.
Number of clients currently connected to the dispatch shard.
Name of the dispatch shard.
Function to handle a dispatch event for a new or updated client connection. Invoked by the [[onConnectedClientsChanged]] listener.
Function to handle a dispatch event for a new or updated client connection. Invoked by the [[onConnectedClientsChanged]] listener.

comment.text: Array of information about the connected clients in the shard.

comment.shortText: Function to handle a dispatch event. Invoked by the [[on]] listener.
Function to handle a dispatch event. Invoked by the [[on]] listener.

comment.text: Data payload sent with the fired event.
Object containing additional information about the event, including the message latency in milliseconds.

comment.shortText: Manages in-app purchase transactions on the frontend of your Koji app.
Generates an IAP token for the current user that can be used to resolve receipts on the backend.
comment.returns: Short-lived IAP token for the current user.

comment.text: If true, logged-out users will be prompted to sign in. This is useful for restoring purchases when a user may be logged out (e.g., purchased a product inside TikTok webview, and then later visited the same app via Safari and is no longer logged in), but should only be used when actively requested by a user (e.g., a "Restore Purchases" button). Otherwise, this should be left false to get the token passively.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to purchase a product from the Koji app. Products are defined in the entitlements file and registered or updated when the project is deployed.
comment.text:
NOTE: If your IAP product is defined with the `captureOnPurchase` key set to `false`, the transaction is held in a pending state until you manually invoke {@doclink core-backend-iap#captureTransaction | Iap.captureTransaction} on the backend of your Koji app.
Funds are not available in the seller's account until the transaction is captured.
If you do not capture the transaction before the `captureExpiryPeriod`, the transaction is automatically reversed and the buyer is refunded.
This period can be specified in the product definition from 0 to 7 days (default is 0).
comment.returns: Results of the in-app purchase transaction.

comment.text: Identifier for the product to purchase.
Optional information to add to the transaction receipt.
Optional key-value pairs to add to the receipt. These attribute values can be referenced or updated by resolving receipts on the backend of the Koji app.

comment.shortText: Results of an in-app purchase transaction.
Short-lived IAP token for the current user. See [[getToken]].
Unique identifier for the receipt, if the purchase was successful, or `undefined`, if not.
Indicates whether the purchase was successful.
Optional information to add to a {@doclink core-backend-iap#IapReceipt | transaction receipt} for a given in-app purchase.
Amount of the purchase, in cents.
Custom message associated with the purchase. This value is stored as a custom attribute on the transaction receipt.
Manages authentication and authorization on the frontend of your Koji app.
Checks whether the user has granted authorizations to the Koji app. Use this method to determine whether to request authorization for certain capabilities.
comment.returns: Indicates whether the user has already granted authorization for the capabilities.

comment.text: List of authorization grants to check for the user.

comment.shortText: Gets a token identifying the current user.
comment.returns: Identity information for the current user of the Koji app.

comment.shortText: Requests the specified authorization grants from the user for the Koji app.
comment.returns: Indicates whether authorization for the capabilities was successfully obtained from the user.

comment.text: List of authorization grants to request from the user.
Custom message to display when requesting the grant.

comment.shortText: Identity information for the current user of the Koji app.
Additional user attributes, which are returned if the user has granted username authorization via [[requestGrants]].

Presumed role of the current user as the owner/creator (`admin`), not the owner (`user`), or not logged in (`unknown`).
Admin actions must still be secured on the backend by resolving the users role.
Short-lived token to identify the user.
User attributes that are determined via a client-side API call.
The user's global Koji account ID
Koji avatar for the user.
Koji username for the user.
Capabilities that a user can grant the current Koji authorization to use.
Enables communication between the platform and the Koji app.
Manages the state of the Koji player to enable distinct experiences for different users and views.
Context of the Koji app.
Focus state of the Koji app.
Whether the player chrome (Koji platform buttons and navigation) is visible.
Presentation style of the Koji app.
Type of receipt.

Hides any Koji player chrome, such as the user's profile icon.
To display the player chrome, use [[showChrome]].
comment.text:
NOTE: Incorrectly controlling the player chrome can result in a disorienting user experience, so use this functionality judiciously.
The player chrome must be displayed on all root screens of an app. It can be hidden if a user navigates to a child screen, such as a modal.
The player chrome is hidden by default when the app's `presentationStyle` is `popover`.

comment.shortText: Listens for event notifications that the Koji app lost the focus and then invokes a callback function to respond to the focus state change.
comment.returns: Function to unsubscribe from the onBlur listener.

comment.text: Function to handle when the Koji app loses the focus.

comment.shortText: Listens for event notifications that the Koji app got the focus and then invokes a callback function to respond to the focus state change.
comment.returns: Function to unsubscribe from the onFocus listener.

comment.text: Function to handle when the Koji app gets the focus.

comment.shortText: Restores the Koji platform chrome, if it has been hidden with [[hideChrome]].
Listens to changes in customization mode and invokes a callback function to enable different experiences during customization, preview, or use.
comment.returns: Function to unsubscribe from the customization mode listener.

comment.text: Function to handle changes in customization mode.

comment.shortText: Describes the editor that the creator is using.
Distinguishes between creating a `new` customized version of the app and doing an `edit` of the users existing Koji app.
Type of editor the creator is using, either `instant` for the Koji player or `full` for the Koji code editor.
URL query parameters that describe the current state of the Koji player.
Function to handle when the Koji app loses focus. Invoked by the [[onBlur]] listener.
Function to handle when the Koji app loses focus. Invoked by the [[onBlur]] listener.
Distinguishes between creating a `new` customized version of the app and doing an `edit` of the users existing Koji app.
Type of editor the creator is using, either `instant` for the Koji player or `full` for the Koji code editor.
Function to handle when the Koji app gets focus. Invoked by the [[onFocus]] listener.
Function to handle when the Koji app gets focus. Invoked by the [[onFocus]] listener.
Function to handle changes in the customization mode. Invoked by the [[subscribe]] listener.
Function to handle changes in the customization mode. Invoked by the [[subscribe]] listener.

comment.text: Indicates whether the app is in customization mode.

comment.shortText:
Presentation style of the Koji app, either in a modal window (`popover`) or the standard player (`fullscreen`).
The player chrome (including the user's profile icon) is hidden by default when the app's `presentationStyle` is `popover`.
Context in which the Koji app is being viewed. A Koji app can provide a distinct experience for each context.
View of the receipt for a transaction, either `buyer` or `seller`.
Who is viewing the receipt for a transaction, either `buyer` or `seller`.
Manages the customization experience for your Koji app.
Cancels the customization experience and returns to where the user was before they started customization. If the user has made changes, they are prompted to confirm the cancellation.
Retrieves sensitive data that was [[encryptValue | stored as an encrypted value]].
comment.text: NOTE: Only the owner of the Koji app can access the decrypted value with this method. For example, to check that the value was entered correctly. To retrieve the value for other users, use {@doclink core-backend-secret#resolveValue | Secret.resolveValue} on the backend.
comment.returns: Decrypted value.

comment.text: Path where the encrypted value is stored.

comment.shortText: Stores sensitive data as an encrypted value. The sensitive data can only be accessed programmatically and is not available when the Koji app is configured.
comment.returns: Encrypted value. Use this value to [[decryptValue | decrypt the value]] on the frontend, for the creator, or to {@doclink core-backend-secret#resolveValue | resolve the value} on the backend, for other users.

comment.text: Value to encrypt.
Options relating to the encryption and storage of the value. Omit for default storage and security options (appropriate in most cases).

comment.shortText: Advances the Koji app's mode from customization to preview.
Gets the customization data for the Koji app.
comment.returns: Object containing the current customization data.

comment.text: Array of keys to target a specific value in the object.
Value to return if no value exists at the targeted path.

comment.shortText: Initializes the Koji app's customization data with default values.
comment.text:
NOTE: In most cases, you do not need to call this method manually because it is automatically called when you initialize the package with `Koji.config`.
Use this method only if you want to use the Remix class by itself, without any other classes in the package.
Object containing the default values for your Koji app.

comment.shortText: Replaces all customization data with the specified object.
comment.text:
NOTE: This method overwrites all existing values in the customization data.
To update specific values only, use [[set]].
comment.returns: Indicates whether the customization data was successfully replaced.

comment.text: Object containing the new customization data for the Koji app.

comment.shortText: Updates the specified values in the customization data.
comment.text: NOTE: This method updates only the values that are specified in `newValue`. If other values exist, they are not changed. To replace all customization data, use [[overwrite]].
comment.returns: Indicates whether the values were successfully updated.

comment.text: Key-value pairs to update in the customization data.

comment.shortText: Options when encrypting a secret value.
Set true to bypass at-rest encryption on Koji's servers, allowing you to encrypt values larger than 4kb.
Communicates changes to the customization data.
New value.
Path of the changed value.
Previous value.
Manages endpoints for the services running in your Koji app.
Key-value pairs of services and endpoints.
Sets the environment variables for the available services in the Koji app. This method automatically scopes the variables for the customized version of the Koji app.

comment.text: Key-value pairs of services and endpoints in the original Koji.

comment.shortText: Key-value pairs of services and endpoints.
Defines the user interface for KojiBridge.
Whether the user completed the selection (`succeeded`) or exited the control without selecting a value (`cancelled`).
Capture method types.
Captures user input on the frontend of your Koji app.
Prompts the user to select a sound by selecting from the available asset packs, by uploading a file, or by entering a URL. Use this method when you want to limit the user to selecting a sound.
comment.text: To allow multiple types of media assets, see [[media]]. To allow upload of raw files of any type, see [[file]].
comment.returns: URL to the audio asset as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL to the audio asset as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select a color, either from a swatch or by entering a color code. Supports HEX, RGB, or HSL by default. Supports RBGA or HSLA, if transparency is enabled in the capture options.
comment.returns: Color code as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the color code as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select a value from a custom control. To build a custom control, use the {@doclink withkoji-custom-vcc-sdk | @withkoji/custom-vcc-sdk package}.
comment.returns: Color code as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the value captured by the custom control.

comment.shortText:
Prompts the user to upload a file of any type.
Use this method to allow the user to upload raw files in their original format.
For example, use this to capture high-resolution images for download rather than for display in a browser.
comment.text:
To apply automatic transcoding and transformations for specific file types, use the associated method.
See [[image]], [[video]], [[audio]], or [[media]].

To provide a custom upload experience or to upload media created or captured during the app experience, use {@doclink core-frontend-ui-upload#uploadFile | Upload.uploadFile}.
comment.returns: URL to the file as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL to the file as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select an image by selecting from the available asset packs, by uploading a file, or by entering a URL. Use this method when you want to limit the user to selecting an image.
comment.text: To allow multiple types of media assets, see [[media]]. To allow upload of raw files of any type, see [[file]].
comment.returns: URL to the image asset as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL to the image asset as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to paste an external URL, create a new app, or select an existing app from their profile.
comment.returns: URL as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select an image, file, audio, or video by selecting from the available asset packs, by uploading a file, or by entering a URL. Use this method to allow the user to select from more than one type of media with a single control. For example, allow the user to select an image or a video. You can limit the types of media to allow and configure options for each allowed type.
comment.returns: Value of the media capture, which is either the URL to the media as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns only the value of the media capture.

comment.shortText:
Prompts the user to select a numeric value within a certain range.
You can configure the minimum value, maximum value, and default increment, as well as an initial value for the control.
comment.returns: Numeric value as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the numeric value as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select from a predefined list of options.
comment.returns: Value of the predefined option as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the option as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to upload a video. Use this method when you want to limit the user to uploading a video file.
comment.text: To allow multiple types of media assets, see [[media]]. To allow upload of raw files of any type, see [[file]].
comment.returns: URL to the video asset as a string or the [[VerboseCapture]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL to the video asset as a string.

comment.shortText: Metadata for an audio file.
Duration in seconds for an audio file.
Configuration options for an [[audio]] capture.
Whether to hide all asset packs and VCC extensions. Enable this option in cases where they do not make sense (for example, Koji apps that sell premium audios).
Configuration options for a [[color]] capture.
Indicates whether to support transparency (`false`, by default).
Default value for the color capture control.
Configuration options for a [[custom]] capture.
App ID of the custom control.
Short name for the custom control. (to be depreciated)
Type options specific to the custom control.
URL where the custom control is hosted. (to be depreciated)
Configuration options for a [[file]] capture.
Configuration options for an [[image]] capture.
Enables image optimizations based on content negotiation.
comment.text:
For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/auto | Fastly auto reference]].

NOTE: Although the WebP format produces images at a higher compression ratio with a lower loss of quality, it is not supported in all browsers.

comment.shortText: Sets the background color to use when applying padding or when replacing transparent pixels in the image.
comment.text:
The value can be in HEX 3- and 6-digit format (for example, `a22` or `cf23a5`), RGB format (for example,  `255,0,0`), or RGBA format (for example, `0,255,0,0.5`).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/bg-color | Fastly bg-color reference]].

comment.shortText: Applies a Gaussian blur filter to the image.
comment.text:
The value can be a number of pixels between 0.5 and 1000 (for example, `50`), or a percentage followed by `p` (for example, `1p` for 1%).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/blur | Fastly blur reference]].

comment.shortText: Increases or decreases the brightness of the image.
comment.text:
The value can be a number between -100 and 100, as follows:

* `0` (default)  Leaves the image unchanged.
* `100`  Results in a fully white image.
* `-100`  Results in a fully black image.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/brightness | Fastly brightness reference]].

comment.shortText: Increases or decreases the difference between the darkest and lightest tones in the image.
comment.text:
The value can be a number between -100 and 100, as follows:

* `0` (default)  Leaves the image unchanged.
* `-100`  Results in a fully grey image.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/contrast | Fastly contrast reference]].

comment.shortText: Removes pixels from an image.
comment.text:
The value starts with the desired width and height of the final image.
The rest of the value determines the position of the cropped region within the existing image.
For example: `150,100,x50,y50` crops the image to 150px by 100px and selects the starting sub region x coordinate to be 50px and the y coordinate to be 50px. `16:9` crops the image to an aspect ratio of 16:9.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/crop | Fastly crop reference]].

comment.shortText: Serves correctly sized images for devices that expose a device pixel ratio.
comment.text:
The value can be any number between 1 and 10.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/dpr | Fastly dpr reference]].

comment.shortText: Controls how the image will be constrained within the provided size (width and height) values to maintain the correct proportions.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/fit | Fastly fit reference]].

comment.shortText: Converts the image to the specified encoded format.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/format | Fastly format reference]].

comment.shortText: Extracts the first frame from an animated image sequence.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/frame | Fastly frame reference]].

comment.shortText: Resizes the height of the image based on pixels or percent.
comment.text:
For absolute heights, set an integer number of pixels.
For relative heights (percent), set a value between 0 and 1 or a value between 0 and 100 followed by `p` (for example, `0.5` or `50p` for 50 percent).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/height | Fastly height reference]].

comment.shortText: Whether to hide all asset packs and VCC extensions. Enable this option in cases where they do not make sense (for example, Koji apps that sell premium images).
Applies optimal quality compression to produce an output image with as much visual fidelity as possible, while minimizing the file size.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/optimize | Fastly optimize reference]].

comment.shortText: Changes the cardinal orientation of the image.
comment.text:
The value can orient the image right or left, flip it horizontally, flip it vertically, or apply a combination of these options.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/orient | Fastly orient reference]].

comment.shortText: Adds pixels to the edge of an image.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/pad | Fastly pad reference]].

comment.shortText: Removes pixels from an image before any other transformations occur.
comment.text:
The value is specified in the same way as `crop`, except that `precrop` is performed before any other transformations.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/precrop | Fastly precrop reference]].

comment.shortText: Optimizes the image to the given compression level for lossy file formatted images.
comment.text:
The value can be any integer between 1 and 100, where 1 is a lower quality image and a smaller file and 100 is the highest quality image and larger file.
An optional second quality level can be specified for use when auto=webp is enabled and a WebP output format has been selected.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/quality | Fastly quality reference]].

comment.shortText: Controls the filter used to resize an image to a higher or lower number of pixels.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/resize-filter | Fastly resize-filter reference]].

comment.shortText: Sets the intensity of the colors in the image.
comment.text:
The value can be any number between -100 and 100, as follows:

* `0` (default)  Leaves the image unchanged.
* `-100`  Generates a grayscale image.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/saturation | Fastly saturation reference]].

comment.shortText: Increases the definition of the edges of objects in the image.
comment.text:
The value specifies the amount, radius, and threshold for an unsharp mask (for example, `a5,r2,t0`).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/sharpen | Fastly sharpen reference]].

comment.shortText: Removes pixels from the edge of the image.
comment.text:
The value can be specified in pixels or percent.
For example: `25,50,75,100` trims the top edge 25px, right edge 50px, bottom edge 75px, and left edge 100px.
`0.25` trims all edges by 25 percent.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/trim | Fastly trim reference]].

comment.shortText: Resizes the width of the image based on pixels or percent.
comment.text:
For absolute widths, set an integer number of pixels between 1 and 8192.
For relative widths (percent), set a value between 0 and 1 or a value between 0 and 100 followed by p (for example, `0.5` or `50p` for 50 percent).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/width | Fastly width reference]].

comment.shortText: Configuration options for a [[link]] capture.
Whether to prevent users from pasting an external link. If `true`, users can select only one of their Koji apps.
App Store ID of a Koji app. Include this value to enable the user to create a new Koji from the link control.
Configuration options for a [[media]] capture.
Specifies the types of media files to allow. If empty or not specified, any type of file is allowed.
Whether to hide all asset packs and VCC extensions. Enable this option in cases where they do not make sense (for example, Koji apps that sell premium media files).
Specifies the configuration options for image files.
Specifies the configuration options for video files.
Configuration options for a [[range]] capture.
Default value for the range capture control.
Maximum value. Default is `100`.
Minimum value. Default is `0`.
Default increment/step size. Default is `1`.
Configuration options for a [[select]] capture.
Default value for the select capture control.
List of predefined options.
Description of the selection for users.
Configuration options for a [[video]] capture.
Whether to hide all asset packs and VCC extensions. Enable this option in cases where they do not make sense (for example, Koji apps that sell premium videos).

Enables HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) for delivery of longer content. When enabled, uploaded videos are transcoded for HLS and return an m3u8 playlist. Use this feature in conjunction with [[https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/ | hls.js]] for controlling playback.
Remuxes video files constructed from getUserMedia MediaStreams, which ensures these files contain correct duration headers before they are delivered.
Specifies the cropping constraints when remuxing a video. If not specified, the video will not be cropped.
Applies a watermark to the uploaded image. Available only with HLS transcoding.
Extended metadata for a [[link]] capture.
Sharing metadata description (`og:description`) of the content at the URL, if available.
If the resource is a Koji app, the apps name, if available.
If the resource is a Koji app, the URL of the Koji apps thumbnail image, if available.
Sharing metadata image (`og:image`) of the content at the URL, if available.
Sharing metadata title (`og:title`) of the content at the URL, if available.
Full URL of the selected Koji or pasted link resource.
Extended metadata for a [[media]] capture.
Metadata for an audio file.
Metadata for an image file.
Size in bytes of the media file.
Type of media: `image`, `video`, `audio`, or `file`.
URL of the selected media file.
Metadata for a video file.
Metadata for an image file.
Natural height of the image in pixels.
Natural width of the image in pixels.
One of the predefined options for a [[select]] capture.
Description of the option for users.
Value to return if the option is selected.
Extended result of a user input capture.
Whether the user completed the selection (`succeeded`) or exited the control without selecting a value (`cancelled`).
Capture method type (for example, `color` or `file`).
Value captured from the user.
Metadata associated with the captured result.
Metadata for a video file.
URL for the video thumbnail.
Types of files to allow for a [[media]] capture. The [[CaptureMediaOptions | configuration options]] vary by media type.
Result of a user input capture.
Provides methods for controlling navigation within your Koji app.
Starts a new customization.

tags.text:
```html
<button type="button" onClick={() => Koji.ui.navigate.createRemix()}>
  Create my own customization
</button>
```

comment.text: ID of the Koji project to customize. Defaults to the current Koji app if an ID is not specified.

comment.shortText: Closes a Koji app that is in a modal window.
Opens the Koji app in editing mode.
comment.text:
NOTE: Check that the current user is an admin before calling this method.
Otherwise, the user will not be authorized to edit the Koji app.

tags.text:
```html
<button type="button" onClick={() => Koji.ui.navigate.edit()}>
  Edit this Koji
</button>
```

comment.shortText:
Opens the sharing dialog box. By default, the dialog box shares the URL of the current Koji.
Specify a full or a relative URL to open a dialog box for sharing a different URL or for a deep link into your Koji app.
comment.text: NOTE: If you use this method to share a deep link in your Koji app, a `koji.to` short URL is automatically created for it.

tags.text:
```html
<button type="button" onClick={() => Koji.ui.navigate.openShareDialog()}>
  Share this Koji
</button>

// full URL
<button type="button" onClick={() => Koji.ui.navigate.openShareDialog('https://withkoji.com/@myname')}>
  Share your profile
</button>

// relative URL
<button type="button" onClick={() => Koji.ui.navigate.openShareDialog('?key=value')}>
  Share this info
</button>
```

comment.text: URL to use instead of the current Koji.

comment.shortText:
Opens the content at the specified URL in a modal window that animates from the bottom of the screen.
If the parent Koji is already displayed in a modal window, the content will open in the same window, replacing the current view.

tags.text:
```html
<button type="button" onClick={() => Koji.ui.navigate.presentInModal(url)}>
  My favorite Koji
</button>
```

comment.text: URL of the content to load.

comment.shortText: Replaces the currently loaded Koji with the content at the specified URL.

tags.text:
```html
<button type="button" onClick={() => Koji.ui.navigate.to(url)}>
 My favorite Koji
</button>
```

comment.text: URL of the content to load.

comment.shortText: Presents dialog boxes and system alerts to users on the frontend of your Koji app.

Presents an alert dialog box to the user.
Use this method for messages that require only an acknowledgement from the user.
For messages that require a decision, use [[confirmation]].
For simple alerts that are dismissed automatically after a delay, without user interaction or a message, use [[systemAlert]].

Presents a confirmation dialog box to a user. Use this method for messages that require a decision from the user, such as to ask whether to proceed with an action. For messages that do not require a decision, use [[alert]] or [[systemAlert]].
comment.returns: Whether the user confirmed (`true`) or cancelled (`false`) the action.

comment.text: Confirmation dialog box to display.

comment.shortText:
Presents a system alert (icon and label).
System alerts are displayed for 1200ms and then dismissed automatically, allowing for an easy way to communicate state changes to a user.
For dialog boxes that show messages and require user interaction, use [[alert]] or [[confirmation]].

comment.text: Type of system alert to display.

comment.shortText: Defines an alert dialog box to show a user.
Information to display to the user.
Title for the dialog box.
Defines a confirmation dialog box to show a user.
Label for the cancel action (`Cancel` by default).
Label for the confirm action (`Confirm` by default).
Question to ask the user (empty by default).
Title for the dialog box (`Confirm` by default).
Type of a system alert `success` (check mark), `sent` (message sent icon), `rejected` (alert icon), and `reported` (alert icon).
Uploads files from the frontend of your Koji app directly to your project's CDN.

Uploads a file to your projects CDN.
Use this method to provide a custom upload experience or to upload media created or captured during the app experience.
For example, recording a video or drawing on a canvas.
comment.text:
To upload files with the standard platform control, use {@doclink core-frontend-ui-capture#file | Capture.file }.

NOTE: To use this method for uploading a file collected by a file input, you must extract the blob and reconstruct the file.
Browser sandboxing will not allow the native file to be transferred.
comment.returns: Unique URL for accessing the file on `images.koji-cdn.com` or `objects.koji-cdn.com`, depending on the type of file.

comment.text: Request options for the file upload.

comment.shortText: Request options for a [[uploadFile | file upload]].
File to upload.
Set to true to handle progress in the app instead of showing the Koji overlay
Media type of the file, which is used to determine whether transcoding or other processing is required.
Options for uploaded videos.
Options for uploaded videos.

Enables HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) for delivery of longer content. When enabled, uploaded videos are transcoded for HLS and saved as an m3u8 playlist. Use this feature in conjunction with [[https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/ | hls.js]] for controlling playback.
Remuxes video files constructed from getUserMedia MediaStreams, which ensures these files contain correct duration headers before they are delivered.
Specifies the cropping constraints when remuxing a video. If not specified, the video will not be cropped.
Applies a watermark to the uploaded image. Available only with HLS transcoding.

comment.returns: Object containing the options

comment.shortText: Changes the value of a custom control

because some assertion libraries check its existance when attaching to a

comment.shortText:
Set the chain preferred by this app. For consumers using the Koji native
wallet, setting this automatically updates the user's connected chain. For
users of other wallets, Koji will notify the user if they are connected
using the non-preferred chain. If not set, defaults to ethereum mainnet.

comment.text: The chain preferred by this app

comment.shortText: Deprecated Web3 JSON-RPC request
Deprecatd Web3 JSON-RPC response

Supported chains
Enables image optimizations based on content negotiation.
comment.text:
For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/auto | Fastly auto reference]].

NOTE: Although the WebP format produces images at a higher compression ratio with a lower loss of quality, it is not supported in all browsers.

comment.shortText: Sets the background color to use when applying padding or when replacing transparent pixels in the image.
comment.text:
The value can be in HEX 3- and 6-digit format (for example, `a22` or `cf23a5`), RGB format (for example,  `255,0,0`), or RGBA format (for example, `0,255,0,0.5`).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/bg-color | Fastly bg-color reference]].

comment.shortText: Applies a Gaussian blur filter to the image.
comment.text:
The value can be a number of pixels between 0.5 and 1000 (for example, `50`), or a percentage followed by `p` (for example, `1p` for 1%).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/blur | Fastly blur reference]].

comment.shortText: Increases or decreases the brightness of the image.
comment.text:
The value can be a number between -100 and 100, as follows:

* `0` (default)  Leaves the image unchanged.
* `100`  Results in a fully white image.
* `-100`  Results in a fully black image.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/brightness | Fastly brightness reference]].

comment.shortText: Increases or decreases the difference between the darkest and lightest tones in the image.
comment.text:
The value can be a number between -100 and 100, as follows:

* `0` (default)  Leaves the image unchanged.
* `-100`  Results in a fully grey image.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/contrast | Fastly contrast reference]].

comment.shortText: Removes pixels from an image.
comment.text:
The value starts with the desired width and height of the final image.
The rest of the value determines the position of the cropped region within the existing image.
For example: `150,100,x50,y50` crops the image to 150px by 100px and selects the starting sub region x coordinate to be 50px and the y coordinate to be 50px. `16:9` crops the image to an aspect ratio of 16:9.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/crop | Fastly crop reference]].

comment.shortText: Serves correctly sized images for devices that expose a device pixel ratio.
comment.text:
The value can be any number between 1 and 10.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/dpr | Fastly dpr reference]].

comment.shortText: Controls how the image will be constrained within the provided size (width and height) values to maintain the correct proportions.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/fit | Fastly fit reference]].

comment.shortText: Converts the image to the specified encoded format.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/format | Fastly format reference]].

comment.shortText: Extracts the first frame from an animated image sequence.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/frame | Fastly frame reference]].

comment.shortText: Resizes the height of the image based on pixels or percent.
comment.text:
For absolute heights, set an integer number of pixels.
For relative heights (percent), set a value between 0 and 1 or a value between 0 and 100 followed by `p` (for example, `0.5` or `50p` for 50 percent).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/height | Fastly height reference]].

comment.shortText: Applies optimal quality compression to produce an output image with as much visual fidelity as possible, while minimizing the file size.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/optimize | Fastly optimize reference]].

comment.shortText: Changes the cardinal orientation of the image.
comment.text:
The value can orient the image right or left, flip it horizontally, flip it vertically, or apply a combination of these options.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/orient | Fastly orient reference]].

comment.shortText: Adds pixels to the edge of an image.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/pad | Fastly pad reference]].

comment.shortText: Removes pixels from an image before any other transformations occur.
comment.text:
The value is specified in the same way as `crop`, except that `precrop` is performed before any other transformations.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/precrop | Fastly precrop reference]].

comment.shortText: Optimizes the image to the given compression level for lossy file formatted images.
comment.text:
The value can be any integer between 1 and 100, where 1 is a lower quality image and a smaller file and 100 is the highest quality image and larger file.
An optional second quality level can be specified for use when auto=webp is enabled and a WebP output format has been selected.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/quality | Fastly quality reference]].

comment.shortText: Controls the filter used to resize an image to a higher or lower number of pixels.
comment.text: For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/resize-filter | Fastly resize-filter reference]].

comment.shortText: Sets the intensity of the colors in the image.
comment.text:
The value can be any number between -100 and 100, as follows:

* `0` (default)  Leaves the image unchanged.
* `-100`  Generates a grayscale image.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/saturation | Fastly saturation reference]].

comment.shortText: Increases the definition of the edges of objects in the image.
comment.text:
The value specifies the amount, radius, and threshold for an unsharp mask (for example, `a5,r2,t0`).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/sharpen | Fastly sharpen reference]].

comment.shortText: Removes pixels from the edge of the image.
comment.text:
The value can be specified in pixels or percent.
For example: `25,50,75,100` trims the top edge 25px, right edge 50px, bottom edge 75px, and left edge 100px.
`0.25` trims all edges by 25 percent.

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/trim | Fastly trim reference]].

comment.shortText: Resizes the width of the image based on pixels or percent.
comment.text:
For absolute widths, set an integer number of pixels between 1 and 8192.
For relative widths (percent), set a value between 0 and 1 or a value between 0 and 100 followed by p (for example, `0.5` or `50p` for 50 percent).

For more information, see the [[https://developer.fastly.com/reference/io/width | Fastly width reference]].

comment.shortText: Specifies the cropping constraints when remuxing a video. If not specified, the video will not be cropped.
Desired aspect ratio.
How the image will be constrained within the provided size.
Applies a watermark to the uploaded image. Available only with HLS transcoding.
Type of the watermark. `creatorProfileUrl` watermarks the image with `koji.to/@creatorUsername`.
